welcomeScreen.readyForLaunch: Your app, almost ready for launch!

loginScreen.enterDetails: Enter your details below to unlock top secret info. You'll never guess what we've got waiting. Or maybe you will; it's not rocket science here.
loginScreen.hint: Hint: you can use any email address and your favorite password :)

demoComponentsScreen.jumpStart: Components to jump start your project!
demoComponentsScreen.lorem2Sentences: Nulla cupidatat deserunt amet quis aliquip nostrud do adipisicing. Adipisicing excepteur elit laborum Lorem adipisicing do duis.

demoDebugScreen.title: What's In This Stack?
demoDebugScreen.tagLine: Congratulations, you've got a very advanced React Native app template here.  Take advantage of this boilerplate!
demoDebugScreen.androidReactotronHint: If this doesn't work, ensure the Reactotron desktop app is running, run adb reverse tcp:9090 tcp:9090 from your terminal, and reload the app.
demoDebugScreen.iosReactotronHint: If this doesn't work, ensure the Reactotron desktop app is running and reload app.
demoDebugScreen.macosReactotronHint: If this doesn't work, ensure the Reactotron desktop app is running and reload app.
demoDebugScreen.webReactotronHint: If this doesn't work, ensure the Reactotron desktop app is running and reload app.
demoDebugScreen.windowsReactotronHint: If this doesn't work, ensure the Reactotron desktop app is running and reload app.

errorScreen.title: Something went wrong!
errorScreen.friendlySubtitle: This is the screen that your users will see in production when an error is thrown. You'll want to customize this message (located in `app/i18n/en.json`) and probably the layout as well (`app/screens/ErrorScreen`). If you want to remove this entirely, check `app/app.tsx` for the <ErrorBoundary> component.
